I then moved to the middle level where I had a good red wine and a very good bacon and clam pizza.  I like this level. I really liked the pizza. 

And, sadly, I'm too full to check out the first level. I'll save that for my next trip. 

All in all, it's now in my top 5 in Pittsburgh.

I'm writing this review after about 5 meals at Seviche.  I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a deviation to the standard American fare.  I'm usually with 1 or more friends and we order a number of small plates.  It's fun to share the experience - and the beer and mixed drinks are a bonus.

I'm in Pittsburgh at least twice a month and The Proper is my go-to place.  The pizza is very, very good and the bacon candy should be illegal  (in a good way).  The really large draft beer selection is worth the trip by itself.

I have been hearing about Gaucho's for the past 2 years but only recently had an opportunity to go there.  Wow!  It was delicious.  I had the fish sandwich and then, a week later, had the steak sandwich.  This is definitely in my top 5 go-to places for anyone visiting Pittsuburgh.
It's not a waste of time - but I expected more.  There are a lot of Belgian beers, some craft beers and not much else. I've never tried the food so I can't comment on that.
Got a FREE breakfast!! They quoted us 15-20 minutes however the wait was around 30 minutes. So when we sat down they offered us a free meal. Great customer service :)

***This review is solely for the Russian masseuse they have at this office. ***

I went in for a massage yesterday because my neck and shoulders were very stiff (I got rear ended a few months ago). As I was lying down, the masseuse placed a heating pad on my lower back. And as she was working on my shoulder / upper back, I noticed that she kept on stopping literally every 2 - 3 seconds (I am NOT exaggerating), and was reaching for something on the heating pad. 
After a few minutes, I finally realized: she had placed her PHONE on my back and was playing with it while giving me a shoulder massage... !!?!?!!! 

Are you speechless? Because I sure was. 

I was in so much disbelief of her unprofessional behavior that I just simply had no idea what to do. 
I finally said "I have somewhere to go, can we end this session short", and got me out of the misery. 

She did not help my symptoms at all whatsoever. This is the 3rd time I've gotten a massage from her, and each session kept getting worse. I have a strong feeling she doesn't like Asians very much. 

Placing your phone on a client's back AND playing with your phone while giving a therapy massage is absolutely unacceptable.

Very nice modern rooms, good service, and great location. The only reason I would give it 4 stars is the elevators are slow and parking was a little bit of a hassle because it was frequently backed up to leave the garage. But other than that it was a good stay!

Disclaimer: j'ai seulement goÃ»tÃ© l'un de leurs croissants. Il Ã©tait pas trop cher, Ã  seulement 1,35 CAD.... et il Ã©tait dÃ©licieux, l'un des meilleurs croissants que j'ai mangÃ© depuis mon arrivÃ©e sur le continent amÃ©ricain.

Je reviendrais Ã  coup sÃ»r!

Uniburger is a good MontrÃ©al burger joint, well deserving its 4 stars. The bulk of those stars, however, come from the abundant and delicious fries rather than the burger itself.

The burger was good, I am not denying this, HOWEVER, since moving to New York I've had my share of good burgers. Theirs was reminiscent of a lesser Shake Shack burger: it had the same feel, the same basic taste for all basic ingredients (beef patty, tomatoes, lettuce...) but it lacked the delicious Shack sauce which brings it all together and elevates the whole burger.

Still, the whole was very enjoyable - I would definitively recommend it as a spot when rolling through town.

J'adore Juliette & Chocolat. C'est le genre d'endroits, presque un salon de thÃ©, qui manque Ã  New York. Rien que la carte des chocolats chauds m'a soufflÃ©e: une petite vingtaine de choix donnÃ©s en "single origin" pour mieux dÃ©guster la saveur du chocolat... wow.

J'ai aussi essayÃ© tous leurs pots de crÃ¨mes (je crois): j'ai adorÃ© le pralinÃ© et le caramel salÃ©. Ce dernier Ã©tait peut-Ãªtre un peu trop sucrÃ©, mais il Ã©tait en mÃªme temps tellement bon...

Leurs desserts n'ont pas la richesse de la Maison du Chocolat, ni la complexitÃ© de ceux de HÃ©vin, mais ils sont dÃ©licieux tout de mÃªme, Ã  leur propre faÃ§on.

Gros coup de coeur de MontrÃ©al.

Frite alors! c'est la brasserie/friterie belge typique revisitÃ©e pour les QuÃ©becquois (comprendre "avec poutine"). Comme d'habitude, j'Ã©tais un peu sceptique. Les frites, Ã§a doit pouvoir se dÃ©guster sans sauce et juste briller par sa qualitÃ© en standalone. AprÃ¨s, Ã§a m'empÃªche pas d'apprÃ©cier des sauces, mais toujours dans un petit pot Ã  cÃ´tÃ© pour pouvoir alterner entre avec et sans sauce. Et puis, du fromage sur des frites? wtf.

Mais j'ai essayÃ© une poutine avec champignons, oignons et boeuf et j'ai changÃ© d'avis. La poutine est, en fait, une idÃ©e gÃ©nial. Le problÃ¨me c'est qu'elle peut servir Ã  cacher un manque de qualitÃ© du produit (les frites par exemple) en la "noyant" sous une masse de trucs. Mais, Ã  Frite alors!, chaque partie de la poutine et la poutine en son ensemble Ã©taient de qualitÃ©.

Un excellent souvenir de MontrÃ©al.

To be honest, I was disappointed by their bagels. I was told that MontrÃ©al bagels could not compare with NY bagels. If I could generalize from this experience, I would say it's true. Ridiculously true.

Places like Ess-a-bagel and Murray Bagels
have ridiculously good sandwiches. Really, I never knew sandwiches could be this good: they are, after all, only slices of stuff between two halves of bread. Those NY bagels elevate sandwiches. By contrast, I got at Fairmount Bagel a simple sandwich. It was good, but there wasn't the the pezzaz that I've come to expect from bagels. Also, the bread was really doughy.

One of the major advantages of this place is that it's cheap: 6,5 CAD for a salmon sandwhich? Yes please! Otherwise, I'll stick to poutine.

I would not recommend this community. The office staff is rude, abrasive and unhelpful. Also they tack on extra fees not in the lease. Upon move out we were advised that they charge a extra $80 "standard cleaning fee" unless we provide a receipt from a professional cleaning company. Neither one of these things are in the lease in any shape or form. They are saying that they charge every single two bedroom unit $80 unless given a receipt. We moved out, meticulously cleaned the unit, passed the move out inspection with flying colors, we were not marked down at all, we were just told we need to pay the $80 "standard cleaning fee" I tried to work with the complex office and advise them thy can't add extra fees that are not in the lease, they refused to help, I tried working with Corporate, they stuck to their guns, they are basically stealing and extra $80 from every tennant at move out, no madder if the unit needs cleaned or not. Stay far from this community.

To start, I'm ONLY giving this place 2 stars because the service wasn't terrible. 

Also, if more people in Phoenix reviewed we could probably avoid most of these overpriced robberies. 

I ordered a cocktail that was actually pretty good. Something with sparkling wine and muddled sage I believe. My Mom had a mango martini. That was also pretty good. They are apparently 'known for their martinis'. Though I find it really hard to believe that they're known for anything. 

As an appetizer we had caprese. It was 12 bucks and came with four tomato slices that were not ripe, four pieces of impostor buffalo mozzarella and a flake of basil. Hands down the worst I have ever had. 

Next came the salads. These were made up of a few greens and half a tomato. Seriously? 

For my entree I ordered a mixed veggie type pasta with oil and garlic. 20 bucks down the drain. My boyfriend had the 'special' which was Cioppino. It was 36 dollars and his stomach is feeling ever dollar of it. 

We took our left overs because we just do that and don't want to be wasteful. On the way home the smell of it was so bad we had to pull over to toss it out. 

This place is a crock. They couldn't get me to eat here again at fast food prices. 

For 4 people (And only 2 cocktails) our bill came out to 180 bucks. What a rip off.

Super surprised to go to a nail salon outside of LA that got what I wanted. It may not be that way with every technician there. But mine was super rad and spent time with me to understand. I'm really picky about my nails. That being said, if you want something super current just be really clear and bring pics. Really great price point. The owner has the most amazing customer service everrrr!!! I went in New Year's Eve.. And there wasn't a taxi that would pick me up. So she personally drove me. That's crazy. Over all it's a basic nail salon with a friendly staff and good price, able to pull off pictures.

Reason I didn't give 5 stars is because I waited 30 plus minutes for my scheduled appointment and they were understaffed. 

Overall awesome though.

I've not only found this storage facility's rates reasonable in comparison with many other facitiesÂ rates, but, in my experience, the peopleÂ who work their have shown a very helpful, friendly and customer-friendly attitude. Without anyone's breaking rules or requesting things that are against the rules, RohilÂ PatelÂ there, at the Cubesmart Miles Road, Warrensville Hts location, have been helpfully accommodating. I am especially grateful to two young employees, Rohil Patel and Angelo Nici, for the help they gave me in aÂ very near closing time. They were all smiles while doing their job and while helping me.

I might add that this facility has been safe and secure and very clean. I've encountered no shady characters lurking around, nor have I seen any signs of storage areas having been damaged or broken into.Â It's very nice to feel safe and secure about one's person or belongings. Thanks, again, to the facility and to the staff.

Our first and our last time eating here. I had a "Chile relleno" the menu said light fluffy batter, I got a hard green chile in an omelet. It was NOT good at all! Our waiter was ridiculous.  We saw him 3x the entire time we were seated. I had to flag him down to get the bill. It's ashame, Lake Las Vegas is a beautiful place to visit.  Next time we'll just get some gelato and call it dinner!

I use to go at this restaurant. But on my last visti, I saw customer bring their used plate or bowl to get food and the employees never say any thing to customers that this is not right. Spechala got tuch their dirty plats or bowl and same Spechala every one elsa use it, Not right. I will never go here again. Taste of food is not same any more.

This has to be the worst lounge I've ever been in. We had to clear the dishes from a table first of all so we could sit. The place was so over crowded as to be a joke for a business class perk. The food is next to non existent. The only thing it has going for it is free booze which is only good for the real boozers in the crowd. For the price you pay for business class, especially international they could do a lot better.
Mac and Cheese poppers look good but taste bland. Veggie pizza that's $16 is made on a thin pita bread- cheap as hell!! Come for the beer only :(  food left me craving something tasty...

Love this place! Lovely atmosphere, top notch service! The chef made me a custom pasta dish, and I mean completely custom not just modified. I was able to sample wines before ordering a bottle and everything was beyond delicious! We had the flourless chocolate cake for dessert and oh my! Fully happy and satisfied! yum!

My penne was swimming in cream when it was no supposed to be. No pesto flavour to be had as it was pesto penne advertised, mushroom was so thinly sliced could not even taste it in all that cream, no flavour at all. The waitress did not seem interested to help me out here, she was 'sorry'. No happy hour, no half litre of wine - skip this location!

Love the tea here. You will not want to go back to Panera tea after you've had the brewed mint tea. Iced tea is just as good. I don't know what he does or puts in it but this man knows his tea. 

The food is simple, a little plain but good. Never gotten fries here but the hummus is smooth and has a nice flavor with good quality olive oil, the pitas are warm and fresh (and you get  two so they will fill you up) and I actually like the kufta here better than Layalina's which is saying something because I love that place (but am not a fan of their kufta). Lentil soup is also tasty and filling. The  falafel does leave something to be desired.

I also don't mind the guy behind the counter. If you absolutely must be kowtowed to with fake enthusiasm and mock-pleasure to serve you this is not your place. This guy smiles at you its genuine.

Dom's has closed, it is true, but the word on the street is the family will be opening a new restaurant, called Butitta's (Dom's last name) at the location of the old now-closed Jillian's on Neil sometime in early 2009 (at least that's what the phonebook ad said). They said they'd still have some old familiar items on the menu but would have new stuff too. So keep an eye out for Butitta's!

UPDATE 11/20/2009: They have a banner outside the building announcing they are now hiring servers and will be opening soon! WOO!

Rubens is back. If you are a Champaign native, this is all you need to know. If you are not or have only arrived in town in the past four or so years, know that this is the best hand-crafted chocolate you are going to get outside of Belgium.  Yes, its pricey. Its worth it.

Tried this for the first time. They've added about a half dozen more tables, have some privacy screens up, decor is cute. Workers were earnest and ready to help. I had the mango green tea and it was tasty, not too sweet, hint of green tea flavor and the jelly was soft and fresh. Only three bucks for a medium too. Service only took a few minutes, no line, just steady customers, few people sitting down. No complaints here!
